fields.label: Does your business have customers who are pre-commencement customers?
Does your business provide designated services covered by item 40, 42 or 44 of table 1 in section 6 of the AML/CTF Act?
Does your business consider the risk posed by different customer types when identifying ML/TF risk?
fields.detail-label: Which types of customers do you consider?

fields.label: Does your risk identification process specifically consider the beneficial owners of customers?
Does your risk identification process specifically consider any politically exposed persons (PEPs)?
Does your business consider its customers' sources of funds and wealth?
fields.detail-label: Describe how you consider customers' sources of funds and wealth.

fields.label: Does your business consider the nature and purpose of the business relationship with its customers?
fields.detail-label: Describe how you consider the nature and purpose of the business relationship.

fields.label: Does your business consider the control structure of its non-individual customers?
fields.detail-label: Describe how you consider the control structure of non-individual customers.

fields.label: Does your business consider the types of designated services it provides?
fields.detail-label: Describe how you consider the risks posed by the designated services you provide.

fields.label: Does your business consider the methods by which it delivers designated services?
fields.detail-label: Describe how you consider the risks posed by your delivery methods.

fields.label: Does your business consider the foreign jurisdictions with which it deals?
fields.detail-label: Describe how you consider the risks posed by foreign jurisdictions.

fields.label: Does your business have customers who are individuals?
Does your business have customers who are domestic or foreign companies?
Does your business have customers who act in the capacity of a trustee of a trust?
Does your business have customers who act in the capacity of a member of a partnership?
Does your business have customers that are incorporated or unincorporated associations?
Does your business have customers that are registered co-operatives?
Does your business have customers that are government bodies?
Does your business have customers with beneficial owners as defined in Part 4.12?
Does your business have customers who are politically exposed persons as defined in Part 4.13?
Does your business have agents authorized to act for or on behalf of a customer in relation to a designated service?
Does your program include risk-based systems and controls designed to be reasonably satisfied that an individual customer is who they claim to be?
Does your business have individual customers who are NOT acting in the capacity of a sole trader?
Does your business collect the individual customer's full name?
Does your business collect the individual customer's date of birth?
Does your business collect the individual customer's residential address?
Does your business have customers who act in the capacity of a sole trader?
Does your business collect the sole trader's full name?

groups.title: Scope and Applicability
groups.description: Determines if the rules in Chapter 4 apply to your specific customers or services.

groups.title: ML/TF Risk Identification Factors
groups.description: Mandatory factors a reporting entity must consider when identifying its ML/TF risk.

groups.title: Customer Categories
groups.description: Identifies which specific parts of the Rules apply based on the kinds of customers you serve.

groups.title: Specific Person Types
groups.description: Requirements for identifying beneficial owners and politically exposed persons.

groups.title: Agents
groups.description: Procedures for agents authorized to act on behalf of customers.

groups.title: Part 4.2: Individuals and Sole Traders
groups.description: Applicable customer identification procedures for individual customers.
